intro: Crotalaria collina, commonly known as the narrowleaf cowpea, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with compound leaves and showy yellow flowers that are often clustered in racemes. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are used in traditional medicine and as a forage crop. Crotalaria collina is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils, making it a resilient species in various ecological settings.
